comments*: Water bodies along the coast of Lake Khanka, between Nikolaevsky Cape and the mouth of the Sungach River, primarily in swamps (in extremely large numbers - in wet detritus and moss), rarely - in swampy channels and ponds rich in organic matter, in channels and rivers originating from nearby swamps (in depths of down to 1 m, silt and detritus). Coordinates approximate.

bibliographicCitation: Hiruta, S. F. & Kakui, K. 2016. Three new brackish-water thalassocypridine species (Crustacea: Ostracoda: Paracyprididae) from the Ryukyu Islands, southwestern Japan. Zootaxa, 4169 (3), 515–539.
comments*: The mangrove forest in Oura Bay, Okinawa Island, is composed mainly of Bruguiera gymnorhiza and Kandelia obovata. The river bottom at the mouth consists of rock, with interstices filled in with silt and organic material.

bibliographicCitation: Hiruta, S. F. & Kakui, K. 2016. Three new brackish-water thalassocypridine species (Crustacea: Ostracoda: Paracyprididae) from the Ryukyu Islands, southwestern Japan. Zootaxa, 4169 (3), 515–539.
comments*: The mangrove forest in Oura Bay, Okinawa Island, is composed mainly of Bruguiera gymnorhiza and Kandelia obovata. The river bottom at the mouth consists of rock, with interstices filled in with silt and organic material.

bibliographicCitation: Hiruta, S. F. & Kakui, K. 2016. Three new brackish-water thalassocypridine species (Crustacea: Ostracoda: Paracyprididae) from the Ryukyu Islands, southwestern Japan. Zootaxa, 4169 (3), 515–539.
comments*: The mangrove forest in Kabira Bay, Ishigaki Island, is composed mainly of Avicennia marina, Bruguiera gymnorhiza, and Rhizophora mucronata. The river bottom at the mouth is sandy silt with some organic material. The salinity at the sampling site ranged from as low as 2‰ at low tide up to around 25‰ at high tide.
